images.summary: This image shows the south elevation of a building, focusing on tall wall framing. The elevation includes various materials such as Gentek vinyl siding in Mountain Moss and Dark Drift colors, asphalt shingles in dark charcoal, and stone column bases. The existing steel roof is to remain. The elevation specifies the use of 2x6 studs at 16 inches on center maximum. The elevation is part of a renovation project, and section callouts A-A and B-B indicate detailed construction sections. The scale of the drawing is 1/4 inch equals 1 foot.

images.summary: This schedule provides details on the proposed south elevation glazing. It lists the quantity, size, glazing area, and total opening area for different window sizes: 3'-0" x 3'-0", 3'-0" x 4'-0", and 3'-0" x 6'-0". The spatial calculation includes a total wall area of 504.40 square feet, with a maximum glazing allowed of 100%, equating to 504.40 square feet. The total glazing area provided is 70.80 square feet, which is 14.04% of the wall area.

images.text_verbatim:
SECTION A-A
SECTION A-A (ISO)
DOUBLE SILL AS PER WALL SCHEDULE
FIRST PLY FASTENED w/ 1/2" dia. LAG SCREWS w/ MIN. 3 1/2" EMBED. INTO TIMBER @ 24" o.c. (STAGGERED)
SECOND PLY FASTENED WITH 3 1/4" NAILGUN NAILS @ 2" O.C. (3 FOR 2x6, 4 FOR 2x8, ETC) SPACED AT 12" O.C. ALONG SILL
STRAPPING AS PER WALL SCHEDULE
EX. TIMBER GIRT
C9x13.4
images.summary: This detail shows Section A-A, focusing on the wall section. It includes a double sill as per the wall schedule, with the first ply fastened using 1/2-inch diameter lag screws embedded 3 1/2 inches into timber at 24 inches on center, staggered. The second ply is fastened with 3 1/4-inch nailgun nails at 2 inches on center, spaced at 12 inches along the sill. The section also includes strapping as per the wall schedule and an existing timber girt. The section is labeled C9x13.4.

images.text_verbatim:
GENERAL NOTES:
1. Seal & Signature are by the person that has reviewed and taken responsibility for design activities.
2. Do not scale the drawings.
3. Check and verify all dimensions and report any discrepancies, contradictions, or ambiguities to the architectural designer prior to issuance of contract.
4. All work to be carried out in accordance with the Ontario Building Code, other applicable codes and standards, and any other authority having jurisdiction.
images.summary: The general notes emphasize the importance of verification and compliance. They state that the seal and signature are by the responsible designer, drawings should not be scaled, and all dimensions must be checked and verified. Any discrepancies should be reported to the architectural designer before the contract is issued. All work must comply with the Ontario Building Code and other applicable standards.
